channel.title: Help. and don't tell me to search
channel.description:
Ok, I've searched, and searched, and tested, and searched, etc. I just can't figure out how to add drops to npcs in Mod Allstar's "All-Starscape." I looked in the npcdrop.cfg and searched for an npc's ID and it wasn't even in it. The search button on this was even more useless and the questons just remain unanswered. I just need a GOOD explanation on adding drops. I can add drops to Delta easily but just can't get how to add drops on Allstar...
Thanks, even though no1 will help and will remain miserable and knowledge greedy. You all should be ashamed that you can't just help someone out with something that will take 5-10 minutes out of your life. This forums could do alot beter without the annoying ass adition of a flame and a "noob calling" every other post. If you think someone is a noob, help change it. Calling them a noob is not going to make them less of a noob. The more you just flame, the less gets done, the more request get posted. If you all would just help out in the first place, there would be so much less request topics and more release topics. What is the big fricken deal that you can't just post help. Don't blame the people asking for help, blame yourself. Without you guys constant negitive comments these forums would be a hell of alot of. What are you hiding that you can't just tell other people. Is it a big secret? Is this knowledge worth money or somthing? Realy people, you need to do some growing up. If all you do is spend every waking moment of your miserable little life flaming those who are lower or beter than you, you will get nowhere. By now I'm guessing that you've lost intrest and have started to type out that flame that you just can't keep to yourself, due to the tiny attention spand of your 10 year-old brain. Seriously grow up, noob is getting realy old. It has lost complete meaning and is one of the most over used words on the internet. Most people don't even know the correct definition of the word but still use it like its "the." Now I know that you are all still going to flame and take sentences and take them out of context so whatever. Do what you please.
Go ahead flame and don't help, you'll just be prooving my point.

[quote=“Jddogg9, post:20, topic:290951”]dude we have been trying…

get a new fucking source for christs sake…

allstar sucks anyways tbh.[/quote]
i want to redo an allstar. like completely redo.
im tired of 317’s with clients…all i end up doing is adding to client.

Read full topic

item.title: Help. and don't tell me to search
item.dc:creator: @Seerofdeath Seerofdeath
item.description:
@Seerofdeath wrote:

[quote=“Jddogg9, post:17, topic:290951”]dude what the fuck… lmao… “i see no npcdrop = 17”

“there is already drops for that npc”

please tell me what your smoking?[/quote]

That because all the shit is mashed together. I FUCKING CRTL+F THEN SEARCH NPCDROP = 17 AND IT DOESN’T FIND ANYTHING. So just stfu.

[quote=“TOMSCAPE BETA, post:18, topic:290951”]So, you see the drops, but you can’t find the drops in your folder, ever thought of getting glasses?

Althought, if your s bothered search the ID for the drops, in every folder lmao.[/quote]
and i did search drops, still not found. If you guys are going to help. Be logical about it.All of the shit you’re suggesting i’ve done with no results. When i add a drop, the npc doesn’t drop. I even compiled, even though .cfg doesnt require compiling. and before you ask, yes i restarted the server…

Read full topic

item.title: Help. and don't tell me to search
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Ya, that works for npc drops…

In Npcs.java or whatever…

if(npc.npcID == XXXX && npc.currentHealth <= 0) { npc.applyDead(); Hashtable<Integer, Integer> itemAmounts;//ItemID, amountToDrop Hashtable<Integer, Integer> itemDrops;//<itemID, probability> loadNpcDrops(npc.npcID, itemAmounts, itemDrops); int pulledItem = (int) (Math.random() * itemDrops.size()); int pulledAmount = itemAmounts.get(pulledItem); //Put your probability method here... client.addGroundItem(client, pulledItem, pulledAmount); }

Or soemthing along those lines. I’m writing my own framework right now, So I can’t really remember how wL bases worked.

Read full topic

item.title: Help. and don't tell me to search
item.dc:creator: @Jddogg9 Jddogg9
item.description:
@Jddogg9 wrote:

npc drops…

npcdrops.cfg

open that…

it should look like this…

//--------NPCID---------DropType--------Item----Amount--

//abbysal
npcdrop = 2263     5510      1            7
npcdrop = 2263     5512      1            5
npcdrop = 2263     5514      1            2

that’s just an example…

first code = npc id…

second code = what it drops …

third code = the amount it drops

fourth code = the percentage of the drop.

if you can’t figure that out i think you should stop

cough coding cough

Read full topic
item.source: Help. and don't tell me to search

item.title: Help. and don't tell me to search
item.dc:creator: @Seerofdeath Seerofdeath
item.description:
@Seerofdeath wrote:

[quote=“Jddogg9, post:6, topic:290951”]one thing?

the most simplest thing there is!

and please don’t tell me to stop spamming when your “spamming” your ass right back… lol

and please, if your going to type, spell out your words. it’s not that hard… plz…please…plz… PLEASE[/quote]
Look down the resent post, you go down them and add your 2cents to a few topics and wait for replies and flame. Troll, bait, flame. GET A LIFE. Don’t tell me how to type. Just stop posting. If it is so simple why didn’t you post help in the first place? Is this like you life’s secret? Just post it. It would take like 5 minutes to do. Just post it. For god sake just fucking post it and stop being an ass.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 25, 2009, 08:33:28 pm[/size][hr][quote=“zyle1992, post:7, topic:290951”]Simple explanation:

Probably a wL base. Therefore, in your process method(which is probably ridiculously large) of your client, make method that parses the information from the Drops.cfg or whatever, and then go into your NPC class, and make it so that when npc.health <= 0, it pulls a certain amount of ints from the parsed int[][], or int[] items, and int[] amounts, and then for(int item = 0; item < pulledItems.length; item++) { addGroundItem(pulledItem, pulledItemAmount); } }

Do you think you can get it from there with the process I explained?[/quote]
What? I’m talking about npcdrops not global drops or somthing like that. Idk what you saying, but ty for acualy trying to help unlike some people. cough Jddogg9 cough

Read full topic
item.source: Help. and don't tell me to search

item.title: Help. and don't tell me to search
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Simple explanation:

Probably a wL base. Therefore, in your process method(which is probably ridiculously large) of your client, make method that parses the information from the Drops.cfg or whatever, and then go into your NPC class, and make it so that when npc.health <= 0, it pulls a certain amount of ints from the parsed int[][], or int[] items, and int[] amounts, and then for(int item = 0; item < pulledItems.length; item++) { addGroundItem(pulledItem, pulledItemAmount); } }

Do you think you can get it from there with the process I explained?

Read full topic

you really just wasted your time because no one will listen to you because “adding drops” is on the verge of the most simplest thing in coding…

if you can’t figure that out…

quit trying.[/quote]
Ty for proving my point.
You are the first jackass to spam on this topic. Get a life or at least go outside. Perhaps you should of read the whole damn topic. You, right then, just made yourself look like the biggest dumbass on here. Read entire topics or just leave these forums.

Yes I know drops are simpile I can do them on delta but cant quiet figure out on allstar. Delta is a hell of alot diferent from allstar. Delta includes %'s and each drop has a diferent line. From what i know allstar isn’t anything like that. IF YOU ARE NOT GOING TO POST A RELIVANT POST TO FCKING POST AT ALL. NEXT TIME THINK BEFORE YOU POST.
